conclusion: Objects A and B move through the air and are placed down at the location of objects C, D, E, F due to gravity.
Object A is positioned above two stacked blocks on the left-hand side, labeled C (blue wedge) and D (green block).
Object B is positioned above a taller pile on the right-hand side, labeled E (orange block) and F (pink block).
Object A will fall onto the two stacked blocks on the left-hand side (C and D).
Object A will first touch the upper green block D, press it straight down, and both pieces will come to rest with C (the blue wedge) still beneath them.
Nothing topples because the center of mass of the little stack is inside the base of support provided by C.
Object B will fall onto the taller pile on the right-hand side (E and F).
Object B lands on the orange block E.
The pink block F underneath is wide enough that the combined B-E-F column remains upright, so everything simply settles into place.
No object tips over or slides away; after the brief impacts all six items (A-F) are at rest in a single vertical stack on each side.
